pairtree

Class PairTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • pairtree.PairPath
      • pairtree.PairTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<PairPath>

    public class PairTree
extends PairPath
implements java.lang.Iterable<PairPath>
    Represents the root of a pairtree, following the rules of the official Pairtree specification. This class allows for iterating over all the paths of the tree.
    See Also:
    Official PairTree Specification

    • Field Detail

      • children

        protected PairPath[] children

    • Constructor Detail

      • PairTree

        public PairTree(java.io.File file)
        Attempts to create a PairTree using the given file. The file should be a directory called "pairtree_root", as per the official specification. If it is not a directory, a runtime exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        file - the root directory of the pairtree
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the file given is not a directory

    • Method Detail

      • getLeaves

        public java.io.File[] getLeaves()
        Description copied from class: PairPath
        Returns an array of all the leaves contained specifically by this PairPath. A file is considered a pairtree leaf if its name is three characters or more.
        Specified by:
        getLeaves in class PairPath
        Returns:
        the objects contained by this PairPath

      • getChildPaths

        public PairPath[] getChildPaths()
        Description copied from class: PairPath
        Returns an array of all the PairPaths that extend through this PairPath.
        Specified by:
        getChildPaths in class PairPath
        Returns:
        the PairPaths that extend through this PairPath

      • getEscapedName

        public java.lang.String getEscapedName()
        Description copied from class: PairPath
        Returns the name of the path, as represented by the PairTree format, after cleansing. This method assumes that the PairTree only contains properly escaped names.
        Specified by:
        getEscapedName in class PairPath
        Returns:
        the escaped name of the path

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<PairPath> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<PairPath>

      • findRoot

        public static java.io.File findRoot(java.io.File scope)
        Searches within the given directory for a sub-directory named "pairtree_root". Returns the first occurrence, or null if none are found. Returns null if scope is not a directory.
        Parameters:
        scope - the file or directory to search
        Returns:
        the root folder of the pairtree, if it exists, or null
